FUSO
pt pt

The Moving Image Laboratory is part of FUSO INSULAR, in co-production with Arquipélago - Contemporary Arts Center. It is aimed at the Azorean community interested in cinematographic art, with the objective of creating new video art works.

Moving Image Laboratory 2023

From July to September, participants have the opportunity to deepen their knowledge about the history of the moving image and create their own videos, under the guidance of artists with extensive experience in this field of work.

In 2023, Daniel Blaufuks and André Laranjinha are the invited tutors. At first, and based on his own work, Daniel Blaufuks will be responsible for the theoretical component of the Laboratory, which will serve as a basis for the development of individual projects. The practical orientation will be in charge of André Laranjinha, with the technical support of Arquipélago - Contemporary Arts Center.

Daniel Blaufuks uses mainly photography and video, presenting his work through books, installations and films. He has a predilection for issues such as the connection between time and space and the intersection between private and public memory.
André Laranjinha, a visual artist who lives and works in São Miguel, has a degree in Fine Arts from the University of Lisbon and works in cinema, video, visual arts, graphic arts and illustration.

Participation in the Laboratory is free of charge and will take place at Arquipélago - Contemporary Arts Center, in Ribeira Grande.



REGULATION

Applications from May 20 to June 20, 2023

Enrollment is open to Azoreans/Portuguese and foreigners living in the Autonomous Region of the Azores, and Azoreans who reside outside the islands and who are willing to be present on the island of São Miguel during theoretical training (July 1st and 2nd, 2023) and on dates to be agreed during the practical training, on the period of the Laboratory.

Emerging or established artists can participate, as well as curious people who are interested in the area of the moving image, with the aim of developing video projects.

The works must be presented in digital video, in MP4, AVI and MOV formats, with a minimum time of 2’ and a maximum of 10’.

The Lab is limited to up to 8 participants.
Participants receive a fee of 300€ for the production of the videos.
Residents on islands other than São Miguel are facilitated to travel between islands to participate in the theoretical meetings.

The final works will be exhibited at FUSO INSULAR – Video Art Screening Festival, which will take place on October 26 to 29th, 2023, on the island of São Miguel.

1. CALENDAR

May 20th to June 20th: Applications open
Applications received after this deadline will not be accepted.
Until June 25: Announcement of the selected

July 1 and 2: Theoretical component with Daniel Blaufuks
Saturday from 10am to 1pm and 3pm to 6pm // Sunday from 3pm to 6pm 
Location: Arquipélago - Contemporary Arts Center, in Ribeira Grande

July 6 to September 30: Practical component with André Laranjinha.
Weekly meetings on Thursdays from 5pm to 7pm
Location: Arquipélago - Contemporary Arts Center, in Ribeira Grande
Previously scheduled individual meetings

September 30: delivery of the videos

2. CONDITIONS OF PARTICIPATION

Azoreans/Portuguese and foreigners residing in the Autonomous Region of the Azores;
Azoreans residing outside the Autonomous Region of the Azores and who are available to attend in person the theoretical training (July 1st and 2nd 2023) on the island of São Miguel and on dates to be agreed during the practical training, on the period of the Laboratory.

3. REGISTRATIONS

Applications must be submitted using the form available online.

Participants will have to send a brief description of the reasons that lead them to enroll in the Laboratory, being able to complement their application with the material they consider relevant (website, links or images of previous works, Youtube, Vimeo, among others).

Requests for clarification should be sent to the email address duplacena@duplacena.com

4. SELECTION

The selection of participants will be the sole responsibility of the FUSO INSULAR organization.

There will be no appeal or complaint against its decisions;

The results will be announced until June 25th on the official FUSO INSULAR page.

5. FINAL CONSIDERATIONS

a) The confidentiality of all data provided by the selected candidates in their applications is guaranteed, the information being used only for the defined purposes;

b) The organization is not responsible for errors in sending or reading the application files;

c) The organization is not responsible for the transport of the participants.

d) the videos produced during the Laboratory are the exclusive right of the author, who authorizes the dissemination of images and other content in all materials and communication supports of FUSO and FUSO INSULAR, as well as in communication actions of its partners and patrons, provided that duly integrated within the scope of the project’s dissemination and without prejudice to copyright ownership. A copy of the video must be kept on file at the Arquipélago – Contemporary Arts Center.
